snippet: A war-crimes tribunal sentenced Salahuddin Quader Chowdhury for crimes dating back to Bangladesh’s 1971 war of independence from Pakistan. He dismissed the verdict as politically driven.
abstract: Bangladesh’s war-crimes tribunal sentences opposition lawmaker Salahuddin Quader Chowdhury to death for rape, mass murder and torture dating to the country’s 1971 war of independence from Pakistan; Chowdhury dismisses verdict as politically driven.

byline.contributor: Julfikar Ali Manik contributed reporting from Dhaka, Bangladesh.

lead_paragraph: A war-crimes tribunal sentenced Salahuddin Quader Chowdhury for crimes dating back to Bangladesh’s 1971 war of independence from Pakistan. He dismissed the verdict as politically driven.

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
